Burma: Dutch East India Company closes its branch in Arakan
China: Battle of Penghu: A Qing fleet destroyed the Tungning navy at Penghu. The king of Tungning Zheng Keshuang surrendered to the Qing.
Germany: Battle of Vienna: The combined forces of the Polish–Lithuanian Commonwealth and the Holy Roman Empire and their allies broke an Ottoman siege of Vienna.
Poland: Battle of Vienna won under command of John III Sobieski
Taiwan: Battle of Penghu: Qing commander Shi Lang leads an attack on the Zheng fleet near Penghu but fails
Battle of Penghu: The Qing fleet returns and defeats the Zheng fleet, occupying Penghu
The Qing dynasty conquers the Kingdom of Dongning; Zheng Keshuang is given a non-hereditary position in Beijing
